org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store

Class DecryptDatabaseTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store.DecryptDatabaseTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class DecryptDatabaseTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Tests that database decryption works, and that various error conditions are detected and dealt with.

    NOTE: Care must be taken to shut down a database before testing the various connection attributes that apply to cryptographic operations, as they are typically ignored if the database has already been booted.

        public void testDecryptDatabaseNegative()

        Tests that the encrypted database cannot be decrypted without the boot password.

      • testDecryptDatabase

        public void testDecryptDatabase()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tests that the encrypted database can be decrypted.

        This is tested by first populating an encrypted database, and then accessing the data in the end by booting the database without a boot password. We verify that connection attempts with incorrect or missing boot passwords before decryption fail.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testDecryptOnBootedDatabase

        public void testDecryptOnBootedDatabase()
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tests that trying to decrypt an already booted database doesn't actually decrypt the database.

        The internal code isn't set up to deal with decryption/encryption while other activities take place concurrently, so crypto operations are only performed when booting a database.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • connect

        private java.sql.Connection connect(boolean decrypt,
                                    java.lang.String bootPassword,
                                    java.lang.String otherAttrs)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Attempts to connect to the default database with the specified attributes.
        Parameters:
        decrypt - whether or not to request database decryption
        bootPassword - boot password, may be null
        otherAttrs - additional boot attributes
        Returns:
        A connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the connection cannot be established

      • populateDatabase

        private void populateDatabase(boolean init,
                              int rows)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Populates the database (simple one-column table).
        Parameters:
        init - if true the table will be created or reset (the identity column will also be reset)
        rows - number of rows to insert
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
